enabled. It is currently gated behind the OobeChoobe flag and the

DriveFsBulkPinning flag, the latter of which is gated behind the feature

management module. It is fine to turn this on by default now for M117

branch.

entry.title: Migrate CrOS functions to new MediaDeviceSaltService API
entry.content:
This CL migrates the CrOS camera app and webcam extension API to

use the new per-storage-key API of MediaDeviceSaltService.



Since these were the last call sites, the global-salt API is

removed. The service is internally still using the global-salt storage

backend, but all call sites are ready for the new backend.



This CL also removes the global-salt version of GetSalt() in the

service and updates fieldtrial_testing_config.json so that some tests

use the new backend.



Bug: 1410462

Change-Id: Ica7b45d781ab81f047af9a868723dc604acd4cd6

entry.title: Migrate WebRTC Audio API to the new MediaDeviceSaltService API
entry.content:
This CL refactors WebRTC Audio extension API so that it can use the new

Storage Key-based API for the salt service.



Prior to this CL this extension API used a global salt, but it used

the extension ID as origin to hash output devices, and a source origin

received as parameter for input devices. This CL uses the new

Media Device Salt Service API to get a separate salt for each origin

so that translations between raw and HMAC device IDs are consistent.



Drive-by: Some lint/style issues.



Bug: 1410462

Change-Id: I5bbd5b6242a65ad4d07174f3ebe7e0a6bc334a22

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4675554

Commit-Queue: Guido Urdaneta

Reviewed-by: David Bertoni

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1172166}

entry.title: Add trybot coverage for Linux V4L2 decoders
entry.content:
Support for V4L2 decoders on standard Linux was recently added and

finished. Since this was previously only used by ChromeOS, which had

relaxed code style checking and other minor differences from the

standard Chrome builds, and V4L2 codecs aren't enabled by default

for Linux, ChromeOS work tends to overlook code style requirements

and other ChromeOS differences that may cause this support to

degrade again.



Add trybot coverage for Linux V4L2 decoders, so that any bad changes

can be caught before they land.



Bug: b:258331312, b:291169645

TEST=none



Change-Id: Icfa880333f2bb8b161578e9982f2ee385c2d146f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4131098

Reviewed-by: Miguel Casas-Sanchez

Reviewed-by: Ben Pastene

Commit-Queue: Chen-Yu Tsai

Reviewed-by: Erik Staab

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1172161}

entry.title: [exo] Update hit test and window resize for SetShape()
entry.content:
Currently the aura_toplevel.set_shape will set the layer shape of the

ShellSurface's host window.



However the resulting window does not correctly implement hit testing

for transparent regions created by the applied shape. The resulting

window also participates in server-side resize, which is disabled

for App windows using SetShape() in ash-chrome.



This CL instead applies the shape to the widget's layer as opposed to

the host window's layer. This is for correctness as the host window's

layer bounds can grow to accommodate all surfaces in the surface

hierarchy.



This CL also ensures correct hit testing by having the

CustomWindowTargeter of the shell surface take into account the

window's shape.



Server-side resize has also been disabled for windows using the

SetShape() API to match the current behavior on ash-chrome.



This CL also cleans up code, eliminating the need for shape rects

in many places.



Bug: 1158733, 1465999, b/286021229

Change-Id: I581a7068d02e03e90c8c91f76363c6a329ac3302

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4665904

entry.title: siso: native remote=False for mojo via reproxy
entry.content:
When `remote_to_reproxy` is true, it sees that remote is still true on

mojo and incorrectly applies its handling.



This is an incremental fix to allow simultaneous `remote_to_reproxy` and `rewrapper_to_reproxy`. We should refactor these two to be more generic.

entry.title: Reland "Prerender: Record activation IPC delay"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 254d9b73fef39806bf919e4fc309e3dc63c24e0b

Due to an existing bug(1415185), NavigatePrimaryPage cannot really wait for the prerendering page to finish loading, and cannot tell

whether the activation signal has been sent to the renderer side or not.



This reland makes the test code send another signal to the renderer

side explicitly, to ensure all signals have been processed, as a

workaround



Original change's description:

> Prerender: Record activation IPC delay

>

> It is possible that the activation IPC was queueing for quite a long

> time before being processed.

> This CL adds a metric to track the delay

>

entry.title: jellyroll shadow [part 5]: system UI shadow
entry.content:
This cl follows crrev.com/c/4676143



Design doc: go/jellyroll-shadow



This change makes the different extensions of SystemShadow have

dynamic colors on theme changes.



To achieve this, the cl makes SystemShadow a

ui::ColorProviderSourceObserver to observe the change of different

color provider source. When the observed color provider source

changes, the shadow will get an updated shadow colors map and use

it to re-render the shadow.



Test: MaterialNext/SystemShadowColorTest/*

Bug: b:252359187

entry.title: Reland "Makes InstallableManagerBrowserTest run on Android as well"
entry.content:
This reverts commit ef04e710d283ad64f1bda6774874c5264195d940.



Reason for revert:

Test CheckLargeScreenshotsFilteredOut failed on android-pie-x86-rel

because image downloader scale the image on some devices.

Fix the test by asserting fetched images smaller than expected size.

(Patchset 1 is the original)

entry.title: Create browser test to use frame origin instead of URL
entry.content:
RFH GetLastCommittedOrigin() is not always the origin of

GetLastCommittedUrl(). In the case of a pop up window. The origin will

be the parent's origin, but URL will be initialized to about::blank.



In this CL, we add a test to ensure CreateChooserTitle uses the frame's

origin instead of URL. This test is done using a browsertest as it is

difficult to recreate this scenario in a unit test setup.

entry.title: [Extensions] Remove a data member from ExtensionWebRequestEventRouter.
entry.content:
This is one in a series of CLs that will move data out of the

ExtensionWebRequestEventRouter that is not keyed by BrowserContext.

This will allow for a more straightforward approach when breaking it

up into multiple per-BrowserContext instances.



There is an ExtensionWebRequestTimeTracker member of this object that

is tracking timings across BrowserContext instances. This CL moves that object into a separate global instance.



No behavior change is expected.



Bug: 1433136

entry.title: [MirrorSync] Create Lit component for Inline Status
entry.content:
This new component displays whether files and folders

are pinned, not pinnable, queued, in progress, or none of those.



The component isolates CSS that was previously located in the

file_manager.css and file_manager_gm3.css into a more succinct

definition that is also co-located with the rendering logic.



This CL reduces code complexity related to inline sync status

and related concepts. It also helps pave the way for efforts in

converting our current virtual list into Lit.



Note that the logic that added 300ms before dismissing

the completed sync status of fully synced files has been

temporarily removed as it was not working realiably in the

first place. It will be reintroduced in a follow up CL.



Bug: b:291173347

Test: browser_tests *FilesAppBrowserTest.Test*

entry.title: Revert "Temporarily invalidate old LocalSurfaceIds of DelegatedFrameHost for"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 04cf528b33ffd4972ebbedba00e4ac7689ed292a.



Reason for revert: Causing BFCache test failures: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-bfcache-rel/49187/test-results?sortby=&groupby=



Original change's description:

> Temporarily invalidate old LocalSurfaceIds of DelegatedFrameHost for

> all navigations.

>

> Prior to this CL, for a navigation (includes activation):

> - WCImpl::DidNavigateMainFramePreCommit()

> - RFHManager::CommitPending()

> - RWHV::Show()

> - DelegatedFrameHost::EmbedSurface() --> Updates IDs.

> - WCImpl::DidNavigateMainFramePostCommit()

> - RWHVBase::OnDidNavigateMainFrameToNewPage() --> Clears IDs.

>

> This flow is problematic in several cases (known ones):

> 1. RWHVMac::OnDidNavigateMainFrameToNewPage does not reset

> DelegatedFrameHost. It wasn't an issue until the fix for a visual

> glitch of ViewTransition+BackForwardCache

> (https://crbug.com/1415340 and [0]).

> 2. (On Aura) Because OnDidNavigateMainFrameToNewPage is called after

> EmbedSurface, for a page restored from BFCache, we could end up

> with a DelegatedFrameHost without a valid LocalSurfaceId (if there

> is no follow up EmbedSurface call after

> OnDidNavigateMainFrameToNewPage). See https://crbug.com/1431273

> - Android gets away with this because Android has extra visual

> synchronization calls that triggers EmbedSurface.

> - Mac/IOS gets away with this because of 1.

>

> This CL renames OnDidNavigateMainFrameToNewPage to

> DidNavigateMainFramePreCommit, and calls it earlier in PreCommit:

> - WCImpl::DidNavigateMainFramePreCommit()

> - RWHVBase::DidNavigateMainFramePreCommit() --> Clears IDs

> - RFHManager::CommitPending()

> - RWHV::Show()

> - DelegatedFrameHost::EmbedSurface() --> Updates IDs

> - WCImpl::DidNavigateMainFramePostCommit() --> Other post-commit tasks

>

> This CL also introduces RWHVBase::DidEnterBackForwardCache, to be used

> when a page enters BFCache to update its LocalSurfaceId:

> - WCImpl::DidNavigateMainFramePreCommit()

> - RWHVBase::DidNavigateMainFramePreCommit() --> Clears IDs

> - RFHManager::CommitPending()

> - RFHManager::UnloadOldFrame()

> - RFHImpl::DidEnterBackForwardCache()

> - RWHVBase::DidEnterBackForwardCache() --> Restores IDs

>

> [0] http://docs/document/d/1g-VBsVVd8tKMzJIJGFooPOCDpxLwlbJTIsNnMOjSef0?resourcekey=0-ChPbTFNCu3C482SVdT4X9Q

>

> the killswitch.

>

> Low-Coverage-Reason: untested WebContentsImpl changes are guarded by

> Bug: 1453638, 1415340, 1431273

> Change-Id: I3f1a4fc1a8981fe8fe9cc61207e1b2d0325bd16c

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4604635

> Reviewed-by: Bo Liu

> Reviewed-by: Ken Buchanan

> Reviewed-by: Jonathan Ross

> Commit-Queue: William Liu

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1172030}



Bug: 1453638, 1415340, 1431273

Change-Id: Ia3f8cfd78bf0742446ce015219c74ec296cabb0f

entry.title: WebUI: Delete obsolete a11y tests based on js2gtest, part 1.
entry.content:
In this part deleting all non-CrOS such tests.



The WebUI AccessibilityTest mechanism is being removed, since it has

not proven very useful, is basically abandoned for a long time and

relies on js2gtest which WebUI tests are moving away from. Porting it

off of js2gtest does not seem like a good time investment, given that

such tests have not proven to be useful. Therefore removal seems

to be the most practical and appropriate option to unblock the removal

of js2gtest.

entry.title: [Extensions] Move the page load callbacks to a separate data structure.
entry.content:
This is one in a series of CLs that will move data out of the

ExtensionWebRequestEventRouter that is not keyed by BrowserContext.

This will allow for a more straightforward approach when breaking it

up into multiple per-BrowserContext instances.



This CL also adds a TODO to investigate why this particular data

structure is global, rather than per-BrowserContext.



No behavior change is expected.

entry.title: Explicitly order hide/unhide operations for pip player controls
entry.content:
Video overlay used to depend on implicit behaviours of

OnNativeWidgetMove and mouse moved events. This is problematic in lacros

because the timing and frequencies are different. In lacros, it is

possible for OnNativeWidgetMove and mouse move events to be several ms

apart. This leads to an observed flickering issue. Note that the rapid

visibility state change can also be observed in all platforms, but is

fast enough that the defect isn't visible. It also implicitly

assumes that a mouse move event will always follow the last widget move

callback.



This change explicitly orders the visibility control during move. When

the widget starts moving, the controls are hidden and all future updates

to the visibility are queued until the widget stops moving. 100ms seems

to be a reasonable number where the flickering cannot be observed and

feels responsive immediately after dropping the widget.



Fixed: 1419589

Change-Id: Ia53a91eb62731f29ff3e837681f94e08e7ce7fb9

entry.title: Add logs and crash dumps if OPRF request fails.
entry.content:
We add logs and generate a non fatal crash dump if the channel is

pre-stable, and the exact net error codes are reached. This will

be used to help understand why such a large percentage of OPRF

responses (~20%), seem to be failing.



We see that a subset of OPRF requests are returning a failed response.

1. Net code = -105 // The host name could not be resolved

2. Net code = -379 // The server returned a non-2xx HTTP response code.

3. Net code = -501 // The server response was insecure.



This change will be reverted after debugging and submitting fix.



Privacy proposal:go/diagnosing-check-membership-failures

entry.title: DeskButton: Prevent out of bounds access for tooltips
entry.content:
This CL prevents the DeskButton from trying to get the name of a desk

that is out of bounds when displaying a tooltip for the left or right

desk switch buttons. Previously, we would not check if the desk would be

out of bounds. This did not cause any issues in the average use case,

but when the emulator is slowed down (such as with asan and slowed

animations), the DeskButton will occasionally try to access the name of

an out of bounds desk when we switch to the far left or far right desk.

This CL fixes that by preventing the out of bounds name access if the

desk we are looking for would be out of bounds.



Bug: b/290977887

entry.title: [IntersectionOptimization] Fix and improve intersection observation in subframes
entry.content:
We always need to run frame viewport intersection update regardless

of scroll delta because

1. Frame viewport intersection reports both viewport intersection

rect and main frame intersection rect. The min-scroll-delta logic

which is based on the intersection relationship between target rect

and root rect doesn't work for the main frame intersection rect,

and it's required to notify frame intersection on every scroll at

least when the frame intersects the viewport or the main frame in

case the intersection rects change.

2. Frame viewport intersection also triggers intersection observation

in remote child frames, which requires not only the above, but also

notification before the frame intersects the viewport in case of

implicit-root observers with root margin in the subframes.



This CL separates frame viewport intersection flag from implicit root

intersection flag. When IntersectionOptimization is enabled, the

MinScrollDeltaToUpdate logic only applies to implicit/explicit root

intersection, but not frame viewport intersection.

When IntersectionOptimization is not enabled, the new flag doesn't

change anything.



Based on UMA data, frame viewport intersection is much faster than

intersection observation, so doing frame viewport intersection on

each scroll won't defeat IntersectionOptimization.



Bug: 1400495

Change-Id: Ie2e296a4f56bf56c3581c61cc00c7f275b9a57a7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4637525

entry.title: mediapipe: add standalone target
entry.content:
To ease the pain of having double the targets this adds a gn

template that generates the two targets. That is, the one

depending on base and the one that doesn't depend upon base.

The templates are mostly drop in replacements, with a few

differences:



. dependencies that have a _standalone variant need to be

called out explicitly. I would have liked to automate this,

but this didn't seem possible.

. configs/public_configs get different names because of how

these are used. By that I mean you generally add and remove

from configs rather than reset the configs completely.



The template also adds an assert that nothing depends on

base.

entry.title: Update the security subpage when deep scanning completes
entry.content:
When deep scanning completes, the download danger type becomes

DEEP_SCANNED_SAFE. There is no security subpage implemented for

DEEP_SCANNED_SAFE downloads, so we want to return to the partial view

entry.title: Temporarily invalidate old LocalSurfaceIds of DelegatedFrameHost for
entry.content:
all navigations.



Prior to this CL, for a navigation (includes activation):

- WCImpl::DidNavigateMainFramePreCommit()

- RFHManager::CommitPending()

- RWHV::Show()

- DelegatedFrameHost::EmbedSurface() --> Updates IDs.

- WCImpl::DidNavigateMainFramePostCommit()

- RWHVBase::OnDidNavigateMainFrameToNewPage() --> Clears IDs.



This flow is problematic in several cases (known ones):

1. RWHVMac::OnDidNavigateMainFrameToNewPage does not reset

DelegatedFrameHost. It wasn't an issue until the fix for a visual

glitch of ViewTransition+BackForwardCache

(https://crbug.com/1415340 and [0]).

2. (On Aura) Because OnDidNavigateMainFrameToNewPage is called after

EmbedSurface, for a page restored from BFCache, we could end up

with a DelegatedFrameHost without a valid LocalSurfaceId (if there

is no follow up EmbedSurface call after

OnDidNavigateMainFrameToNewPage). See https://crbug.com/1431273

- Android gets away with this because Android has extra visual

synchronization calls that triggers EmbedSurface.

- Mac/IOS gets away with this because of 1.



This CL renames OnDidNavigateMainFrameToNewPage to

DidNavigateMainFramePreCommit, and calls it earlier in PreCommit:

- WCImpl::DidNavigateMainFramePreCommit()

- RWHVBase::DidNavigateMainFramePreCommit() --> Clears IDs

- RFHManager::CommitPending()

- RWHV::Show()

- DelegatedFrameHost::EmbedSurface() --> Updates IDs

- WCImpl::DidNavigateMainFramePostCommit() --> Other post-commit tasks



This CL also introduces RWHVBase::DidEnterBackForwardCache, to be used

when a page enters BFCache to update its LocalSurfaceId:

- WCImpl::DidNavigateMainFramePreCommit()

- RWHVBase::DidNavigateMainFramePreCommit() --> Clears IDs

- RFHManager::CommitPending()

- RFHManager::UnloadOldFrame()

- RFHImpl::DidEnterBackForwardCache()

- RWHVBase::DidEnterBackForwardCache() --> Restores IDs



[0] http://docs/document/d/1g-VBsVVd8tKMzJIJGFooPOCDpxLwlbJTIsNnMOjSef0?resourcekey=0-ChPbTFNCu3C482SVdT4X9Q



the killswitch.



Low-Coverage-Reason: untested WebContentsImpl changes are guarded by

Bug: 1453638, 1415340, 1431273

Change-Id: I3f1a4fc1a8981fe8fe9cc61207e1b2d0325bd16c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4604635

Reviewed-by: Bo Liu

Reviewed-by: Ken Buchanan

entry.title: infra: Stop granting mdb/chrome-troopers root swarming trigger access
entry.content:
mdb/chrome-troopers is an overly broad group, and right now anyone in

that group has access to run led tasks in chromium.ci. Ideally led

testing is done in try. And giving mdb/chrome-troopers trigger access

into ci likely sent the wrong message to some folks in that group that

aren't familiar with the infra or with led preferences.



So this removes chrome-troopers from being

given root trigger access into all of chromium's swarming pools. It's

replaced with the much more limited and relevant group

chrome-browser-infra.

entry.title: Do not add operator* in copy constructors and initListExprs
entry.content:
Remove Extraction/Dereference in copy constructors as well as

initializer lists where we're initializing a reference field with a

reference field.



Prior to this change, member expressions in copy constructor

initializers for reference fields were rewritten to add the unnecessary

operator*. Similarly, member expressions inside initList expressions

that are used to initialize reference fields were rewritten to add

operator*. In the following examples, `o.ref` is no longer rewritten

into `*o.ref` after this change.



Example 1:

`a_class_name(const a_copy_ctr& o):ref(o.ref){}`

Example 2:

`a_simple_struct a{o.ref};` where `a_simple_struct` does not define a

constructor.





Bug: 1395816

Change-Id: Ic99364854f8fcdc6b4c9489f6b688e6154bf501a

entry.title: [DIPS] Update deletion latency metric to ignore scheduling time
entry.content:
Previously, the deletion latency metric included the time from requesting a deletion to completing a deletion. This couples the time it takes for the task to be scheduled with the execution of the task. Some very large P99 latencies have been recorded, which may be simply due to the scheduling time on the low priority thread. Now, limit dips deletion latency metric to specify just the deletion time, ignoring the time to schedule deletion on the low priority thread. This will decouple scheduling and deletion time so that the large tail latencies can be better understood.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Privacy.DIPS.DeletionLatency]=this metric was too broad and has been updated in Privacy.DIPS.DeletionLatency2 to be more specific to the actual deletion time without including any extra time spent scheduling the task.



Bug: 1446681

entry.title: mediapipe: add include and update visibility
entry.content:
registration.h uses macros such as CHECK_*, so it needs to

include absl's check. Without this errors such as the following are

generated:



In file included from ../../third_party/mediapipe/src/mediapipe/framework/api2/node.h:8:

In file included from ../../third_party/mediapipe/src/mediapipe/framework/api2/contract.h:10:

In file included from ../../third_party/mediapipe/src/mediapipe/framework/api2/packet.h:18:

In file included from ../../third_party/mediapipe/src/mediapipe/framework/packet.h:30:

../../third_party/mediapipe/src/mediapipe/framework/deps/registration.h:274:7: error: use of undeclared identifier 'CHECK_EQ'

274 | CHECK_EQ(1u, names.size())



This also adds absl's log/check to a bunch of places that needed.

need to be made public so new parent Sections can compose child

entry.title: Add NetworkService.IpProtection.TotalTimeNotCached UMA
entry.content:
This is similar to Net.HttpJob.TotalTimeNotCached, but only for IP Protected requests.



This requires recording in the HttpResponseInfo whether a request was

handled via an IP Protected stream, which is accomplished via a new

`is_for_ip_protection()` in ProxyInfo.
